definition.para: A person or corporate body responsible for publishing the resource.

customization.para: Search the Library of Congress Name Authority File via id.loc.gov for the publisher name (could be an individual or a corporate body).

If a potential match is found, confirm that it is the person or corporate body associated with the resource. In order to do this it may be helpful to review information included in the web display such as source(s) of information and occupation (for persons), and/or to follow the links provided for exact and/or closely matching concepts from other schemes.
Copy the name string for use just as it appears at the top of the page, above the URI(s), including dates.
If no record exists, Romanize the publisher name as it appears on the title page (or elsewhere if not on the title page) according to the ALA-LC Ladino romanization table.
For a personal name like Alexander Ben Guiat, "Ben" is considered part of the first name and is transcribed as: "Guiat, Alexander Ben".
Publisher names usually appear on title page after the following designations: publikado por mano; publikado por.
If entering multiple values for this property, separate each using a semicolon and space (“; “). Order of values does not matter.
